body: If you saw her at all, you'd see her in a cemetery late at night. She'd be clambering about one of those huge cemeteries in Brooklyn and Queens, the ones beneath the flight paths to La Guardia and Kennedy, the ones you can see from certain expressways; the graveyards with comforting names like Evergreen, Mount Neboh and Cypress Hills. She was there
title: Gloria Marie Stradtner, 72, Protector of Animals, Dies

author: William R. Everdell teaches history at St. Ann's School in Brooklyn and is the author of ''The First Moderns.''
body: THE NEIGHBORHOODS OF BROOKLYN Introduction by Kenneth T. Jackson. John B. Manbeck, consulting editor. title: Artful Dodgers

title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: BROOKLYN UP CLOSE; From Red Hook to Cypress Hills: When and Where the Community Boards Meet

body: By age 5, Rishi Maharaj was waving an American flag. By the time he was a teen-ager, he was haranguing his family to register to vote. Years before he cast his first vote, he was volunteering for political campaigns and manning the local polls. His patriotic zeal did not seem to matter much one evening in late September, though. While walking along
title: United Ethnically, and by an Assault; Two Groups of East Indians Are Brought Closer, for Now

body: Relatives of a woman who died last Wednesday while in police custody demanded an investigation into her death yesterday, and their lawyers said their own preliminary inquiry suggested she had been beaten by two detectives and a police officer in a Brooklyn station house. The lawyers declined to say who might have reported that the woman, Yvette
title: Family Seeks Inquiry on Death Of Woman in Police Custody

body: The only comfort that Angel Mendoza could find when he buried his older brother, Melvin, four years ago was the thought that he at least had laid him to rest in a beautiful place. Perched on top of a hill in Cypress Hills Cemetery, a sprawling 200-acre site that straddles Queens and Brooklyn, the elder Mr. Mendoza would own in death something he
title: A Final Resting Place That Isn't; Crumbling Landfill Encroaches on Cemetery's Tranquillity

body: Wearing blackface and Afro wigs, the men who piled into a pickup truck for the Labor Day parade in Broad Channel, Queens, were trying to win a trophy. For decades, parade organizers have awarded trophies for categories like ''cutest baby'' or ''most popular pet,'' and the men had won ''funniest float'' for nine straight years. Within Broad Channel,
title: An Island That Sees No Racism; Enclave in Queens Defends a Float, and a Way of Life

body: New York's State Legislature is mostly a closed shop, where incumbents are protected by a complex petitioning process and an unfair fund-raising system. But there are a few competitive primary contests in New York City on Sept. 15. Here are our recommendations in 10 races in overwhelmingly Democratic districts where nomination is tantamount to
title: Choices for the State Legislature

body: They were not merely up-and-coming officials from the same Brooklyn neighborhood, but kindred politicians close enough to have been the best of friends for years. Over nightcaps in neighborhood bars, they planned their political futures. They worked on each other's campaigns. They went to family reunions together and even, at times, vacationed
title: A Brooklyn Race Pits Two Former Friends and Allies

body: FARRINGTON-Grace L. On July 7, 1998. Beloved mother of Scott Farrington and family, sister of Russell Farrington & family & the late Harold Farrington and family. Reposing Redden Funeral Home, 325 West 14 St., NYC Sunday 46PM, Monday 9:30-11AM, service following at 11AM. Interment Cypress Hills Cemetery, Brooklyn.
title: Paid Notice: Deaths FARRINGTON, GRACE L.

body: MULHOLLAND-Lillian (nee Husted). Of Pinellas Park, FL on July 5, 1998 at 86 years, after a brief illness. Devoted wife of the late Daniel J. Loving mother of Daniel E. and his wife Patricia of Port Washington, NY, and Diane Hanlon and her husband Edward of E. Northport, NY. Grandmother of Melanie Little, Julie, Daniel D. and Patrick, Edward and
title: Paid Notice: Deaths MULHOLLAND, LILLIAN (NEE HUSTED)

body: With less than three months left before 14,000 4-year-olds are supposed to begin new pre-kindergarten classes established by the state, New York City's overcrowded public school system is planning to enroll a third of those children in private and parochial preschools. Unable to squeeze the preschoolers into public schools ripping at the seams,
title: NEW YORK ENLISTS PRIVATE SCHOOLS

body: Agreeing with a woman who claimed she was raped because the Housing Authority failed to supply adequate security in her Brooklyn housing project, a jury in Federal District Court in Brooklyn awarded her $3 million in damages yesterday. The woman was raped in a hallway of the Cypress Hills housing projects, in East New York, in 1992. Cypress Hills
title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; Housing Authority Found Liable in Rape

body: AT 8:30 A.M., we stoked up on egg and cheese sandwiches at the White Castle on Atlantic Avenue. ''I always eat at least three,'' Arlene Schulman said. ''You need a lot of energy for these fifth graders. They are so smart. You'll see.'' But first we scoped the neighborhood: Cypress Hills in northern East New York. We carried copies of the letters
title: COPING; Fifth Graders' Letters Await Mayor's Answer

body: IN the Cypress Hills section of Brooklyn, close to the Queens border, Jean M. Reynolds is becoming expert in a housing relocation technique known as checkerboarding. The checkerboard player moves tenants from one apartment to another, usually in a different building, with the option to return when renovations are complete. As one of the smaller and
title: PERSPECTIVES; Speeding the Pace of Recycling in City-Run Housing

body: Mae West may have been America's premier bad girl and sassiest sinner, but for some people, the lady was not a tramp -- she was a saint. One of her greatest champions is Bishop Andre Penachio, the pastor of the St. Thomas Liberal Catholic Church on West 144th Street. A devoted fan and longtime friend of the Little Chickadee, Bishop Penachio has
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: UPPER EAST SIDE; The Lady Is a Stamp?
